plot: The town is forced to remove anything that either has anything to do with Christmas or is offensive in the least bit to anyone. And Kyle tries to convince everyone of the existence of "Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo."

As the holiday season approaches in South Park, Kyle finds himself in a bind. On the one hand, he feels left out as the only Jew when everyone is celebrating Christmas. On the other, none of the other kids believe him when he tries to tell them about Mr. Hankey, the Christmas Poo. When the real Mr. Hankey shows up, only Kyle can see him and ends up getting locked in a mental hospital. Meanwhile, the rest of the town is in an uproar, with everyone finding something in the school holiday pageant to be offended by.—Jean-Marc Rocher <rocher@fiberbit.net>

Kyle is the only Jewish boy in South Park, and is feeling excluded at Christmas time until a talking piece of excrement named Mr. Hankey shows him the true meaning of Christmas. Meanwhile, the town of South Park attempts to make the holiday politically correct.—Mike
